result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles J. Brill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.
  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and comply with any recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
The jail sentence shall begin immediately. The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The costs shall be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning June 1, 2018.

The jail sentence shall begin immediately.  The jail sentence shall be served with huber and good time.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10.

Letter to Defendant

Defendant Charles J. Brill in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant did not want to review the PSI.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty regarding sentencing.  No statement by Attorney Brill.  Court orders on counts 1 through 10 a withheld sentence placement on probation for three years with conditions of court costs; DNA sample; surcharge on count 1 only; AODA; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; six months county jail on each count concurrent to each other.  Jail sentence shall begin immediately.  Count 11 court orders court costs; DNA sample and 30 days county jail concurrent to counts 1 through 10 with 2 days sentence credit.  Court orders on count 11 that defendant is to pay the costs at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning June 1, 2018.    Appeal rights and notice regarding voting rights ineligibility given to defendant.  Defendant refused to sign the paperwork.  - rt
Days Credit Worksheet
and Peremptory Challenges

Sentencing hearing on April 24, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Charles J. Brill in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Outside the presence of the jury,  Housekeeping matters.  State requests sequestration of witnesses.  So ordered by the court.  Court goes over procedures with defendant regarding the jury trial.  Oath given to entire jury panel.  Oath given to jury panel that was selected.  Recess at 9:50 am  Reconvene at 10:03 am.  Opening Statements.  Deputy Anthony Schuett sworn and examined.  K.H. sworn and examined.   Recess at 10:54 am  Reconvene at 11:08 am.  Detective Aemus Balsis sworn and examined.  Recess for lunch at 11:53 am  Reconvene at 1:03 pm.  Detective Aemus Balsis retakes the stand.  Jury out at 1:12 pm  Question to court by Mr. Brill  Jury Back at 1:13 pm   Continuation of examination of Detective Balsis.  State rests.  Jury out at 1:35 pm.  Jury back at 1:42 pm.  J.B. sworn and examined.  Jury out at 1:49 pm.  Court questions defendant regarding his right to testify.  Court finds that Mr. Brill freely, voluntarily and intelligently waives his right to testify.  Court goes over jury instructions with parties.   Recess until 2:15 pm  Reconvene at 2:23 pm   Court continues going over jury instructions.  Jury Back at 2:26 pm  Court reads jury instructions to jury.  Closing arguments.  Final jury instructions read to the jury.  Jury out for deliberations at 3:31 pm  Jury back with verdict at 4:24 pm  -   Defendant was found guilty of 11 counts charged.  Jury polled.  Court finds count 10 as a second offense.  State moves for judgment on the verdict.  Granted by the court.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders a presentence investigation.  Court maintains bond as presently exists.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 24, 2018 at 01:00 pm.
by B.J.R.

Defendant Charles J. Brill in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Cveykus is requesting that Mr. Brill if he wants to can also file his own brief challenging the search.  Attorney Cveykus indicated that he would file Mr. Brill's brief electronically with the court when he files his brief.   Detective Aemus Balsis sworn and examined.  Mr. Brill would like the jury trial videotaped.  The court denies that request.  Court will give a written ruling after the parties have filed their briefs according to the briefing schedule.  - rt

Defendant Charles J. Brill in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Cveykus indicated that Mr. Brill did make an appointment but did not keep his appointment.  Mr. Cveykus indicated that Mr. Brill does not want a court appointed attorney.  Court recites the history of the case.  Attorney Cveykus has no objection to be stand by counsel for the filing of motion that has been heard. Stand by counsel will be at county expense.  Mr. Cveykus will only represent Mr. Brill for the motions.  Mr. Brill will represent himself for any further proceedings after the motion. Mr. Brill is to contact Attorney Cveykus immediately after court.  He is going to the Clerk of Court's office to contact Mr. Cveykus's office and set up an appointment. State indicates that H.M. did not give a statement.  Mr. Brill wants to know who the individual is that made a statement against him.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Court denies Mr. Brill's motion. *Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription; not possess any firearms; not possess any drug paraphernalia.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $5000 cash bond with conditions of:  Booking,  Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and not possess any firearms.   Response by defendant.  Court ordered a $10,000 signature bond with conditions as requested with the addition of not possessing drug paraphernalia.  Initial appearance set for 06-03-2014  at 1:00 p.m.
Taylor County Arrest Report
